Trial_Design.evidence: Patients, disease-free after CRC metastasectomy and perioperative chemotherapy (n = 74), were randomized

Participants.evidence: Patients, disease-free after CRC metastasectomy and perioperative chemotherapy

Intervention.evidence: randomized to injections of autologous DCs modified with PANVAC (DC/PANVAC) or PANVAC with per injection GM-CSF

Objective.evidence: Objective: To determine whether 1 of 2 vaccines based on dendritic cells (DCs) and poxvectors encoding CEA (carcinoembryonic antigen) and MUC1 (PANVAC) would lengthen survival in patients with resected metastases of colorectal cancer (CRC).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Endpoints were recurrence-free survival overall survival, and rate of CEA-specific immune responses.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Patients, disease-free after CRC metastasectomy and perioperative chemotherapy (n = 74), were randomized

Result_Outcome.evidence: Recurrence-free survival at 2 years was similar (47% and 55% for DC/PANVAC and PANVAC/GM-CSF, respectively) ( χ 2 P = 0.48).
